shared.locations

Class EdgeLocation

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.locations.EdgeLocation

  • public class EdgeLocation
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the location of an edge on a hex map

      Tells you if this edge is adjacent to another
      boolean isSpoke()
      Tells you whether or not this edge is a "spoke" A spoke refers to an edge that points away from the center, whereas a non-spoke (wheel) is an edge that lines the border at a radius.

      • getNormalizedLocation

        public EdgeLocation getNormalizedLocation()
        Returns a canonical (i.e., unique) value for this edge location. Since each edge has two different locations on a map, this method converts a hex location to a single canonical form. This is useful for using hex locations as map keys.
        Returns:
        Normalized hex location
